Data.event_text: 1 January  India begins its two-year tenure (202122) as a non-permanent member of the UNSC.

links.text: -"India set to begin its two-year tenure as non-permanent member of UNSC". The Hindu. 1 January 2021. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 3 January 2021.-
-"India set to begin its two-year tenure as non-permanent member of UNSC". The Hindu. 1 January 2021. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 3 January 2021.-

Data.event_text: 2 January  India approves two coronavirus vaccines, Bharat Biotech's "Covaxin" and the Oxford/AstraZeneca "Covishield", for emergency use. Experts raised questions over the efficacy of Covaxin and a lack of transparency in trials.

links.text: -"India's Vaccine Wait Over; Serum Institute, Bharat Biotech Get Approval". NDTV.com. Retrieved 3 January 2021.-
-"Coronavirus: India approves vaccines from Bharat Biotech and Oxford/AstraZeneca". BBC News. 3 January 2021. Retrieved 3 January 2021.-
-Koshy, Jacob (3 January 2021). "Coronavirus | Experts raise questions over 'hasty' approval for COVID-19 vaccines". The Hindu. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 28 June 2021.-
-Koshy, Jacob (3 January 2021). "Coronavirus | Experts raise questions over 'hasty' approval for COVID-19 vaccines". The Hindu. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 28 June 2021.-
-"Coronavirus | India approves COVID-19 vaccines Covishield and Covaxin for emergency use". The Hindu. 3 January 2021. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 28 June 2021.-
-"Coronavirus | India approves COVID-19 vaccines Covishield and Covaxin for emergency use". The Hindu. 3 January 2021. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 28 June 2021.-

Data.event_text: 3 January - Former Indian national cricket team captain Sourav Ganguly suffered a mild cardiac arrest. Social media criticism rose against Adani Wilmar Group's Fortune Edible Oil brand's healthy heart advertisement campaign of which Ganguly is a brand ambassador. The company pulled down the advertisements featuring Ganguly following the criticism and trolls.

links.text: -"Sourav Ganguly's advertisements for cooking oil pulled down after his heart issues". Scroll.in. 7 January 2021. Retrieved 4 July 2021.-
-Tewari, Saumya (14 February 2021). "Sourav Ganguly returns in Fortune Oil ad to address health ailment concerns". mint. Retrieved 4 July 2021.-

Data.event_text: 4 January - Instant messaging app WhatsApp announced a new amendment in their privacy policies and data sharing norms. This led to massive outrage against the app and an exodus to alternative applications by users in India. The announcement that WhatsApp will share data with their parent company Facebook led to a surge in the user bases of applications like Signal.

links.text: -"WhatsApp faces first legal challenge in India over privacy". The Hindu. 15 January 2021. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 3 February 2021.-
-"WhatsApp faces first legal challenge in India over privacy". The Hindu. 15 January 2021. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 3 February 2021.-

-"Signal downloads skyrocketed 4,200% after WhatsApp announced it would force users to share personal data with Facebook. It's top of both Google and Apple's app stores". Business Insider. Retrieved 3 February 2021.-

Data.event_text: 12 January - The Supreme Court issues a stay order thereby suspending the implementation of the three new farm laws in the wake of the ongoing farmer protests.

links.text: -Rajagopal, Krishnadas (12 January 2021). "Farmers' protest | Supreme Court stays implementation of 3 controversial farm laws". The Hindu. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 15 January 2021.-
-Rajagopal, Krishnadas (12 January 2021). "Farmers' protest | Supreme Court stays implementation of 3 controversial farm laws". The Hindu. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 15 January 2021.-
-"Supreme Court puts on hold 3 farm laws, sets up 4-member committee to hold talks". India Today. 12 January 2021. Retrieved 15 January 2021.-

Data.event_text: 14 January - Former NDTV journalist Nidhi Razdan announced that she fell prey to a serious phishing attack in 2020 that came as a job offer for a teaching position at Harvard University.

links.text: -"Blog: I Am Nidhi Razdan, Not A Harvard Professor, But..." NDTV.com. Retrieved 1 July 2021.-

Data.event_text: The Indian Government begins a mass vaccination campaign for COVID-19. The vaccine for preventing COVID-19 is prepared by Bharat Biotech.

A 500-page transcript of WhatsApp chat between Arnab Goswami and former Broadcast Audience Research Council CEO Partho Dasgupta was leaked to media. The transcripts revealed that Arnab Goswami was privy to top secret information regarding 2019 Balakot airstrike and 2019 Pulwama attack. It also carried derogatory remarks made by Arnab Goswami on political activists, opposition leaders, media persons like Navika Kumar, celebrity like Kangana Ranaut etc.

links.text: -"Arnab's WhatsApp chat shows leak of classified information, requires Parliamentary Committee probe, says NCP". The New Indian Express. 17 January 2021. Retrieved 22 July 2021.-
-Gautam, Nishtha (26 January 2021). "'Arnabgate' Explained: From PJ's Poetry for 'NM' to Quid Pro Quo". TheQuint. Retrieved 22 July 2021.-
-Bhushan, Bharat (25 January 2021). "'Arnabgate' undermines the Modi govt's national security narrative". Business Standard India. Retrieved 22 July 2021.-
-Singh, Navya (15 January 2021). "Arnab Goswami's 500 Page Alleged WhatsApp Chat With Former BARC CEO Leaked On Social Media". thelogicalindian.com. Retrieved 22 July 2021.-

Data.event_text: Five people are killed in a fire at the Serum Institute of India Building, Pune.

links.text: -"Pune: Five People die in Massive Fire at Serum Institute of India Building". 22 January 2021.-

Data.event_text: 26 January - The 72nd Republic Day Parade took place in New Delhi. Owing to the COVID-19 pandemic, no foreign head of state served as the chief guest. The Prime Minister of the United Kingdom, Boris Johnson, cancelled his appearance due to the pandemic. The event took place with a smaller spectator size than usual and there were an air show by Rafale jets.  A massive tractor rally took place in Delhi as part of the farmers' protest against new farm bills. There was ensuing violence and a serious law and order situation that followed the rally, and the Delhi Police alleged that an illegal flag hoisting took place at Red Fort by Deep Sidhu. There were massive crack down by security agencies on farmers, journalists, etc. followed by internet shutdowns in Delhi.

links.text: -"Why we don't have a chief guest at today's Republic Day parade". www.timesnownews.com. 26 January 2021. Retrieved 3 February 2021.-
-"Republic Day parade ends with Rafale fighter jets carrying out 'Vertical Charlie'". Zee News. 26 January 2021. Retrieved 3 February 2021.-
-"Farmers' protests | Tractor rally turns violent as farmers enter Capital". The Hindu. 26 January 2021. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 3 February 2021.-
-"Farmers' protests | Tractor rally turns violent as farmers enter Capital". The Hindu. 26 January 2021. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 3 February 2021.-

-Scroll Staff (26 January 2021). "In photos: As farmers begin tractor rally, India sees two parades on Republic day". Scroll.in. Retrieved 3 February 2021.-
-"Delhi Police announce cash reward for info on Deep Sidhu, 3 more accused in R-Day violence". Tribuneindia News Service. Retrieved 3 February 2021.-
-"Here's What Really Happened During the Republic Day Tractor Rally". The Wire. Retrieved 3 February 2021.-
-Dutt, Barkha. "Opinion | India is at war with itself — and even Rihanna is noticing". Washington Post. ISSN 0190-8286. Retrieved 3 February 2021.-

Data.event_text: 7 February - 2021 Uttarakhand flood.
13 February - A 6.3 magnitude earthquake occurred in Tajikistan. Tremors were felt in parts of North India, including Delhi.

links.text: -"6.3 Earthquake In Tajikistan, Tremors Felt In Delhi, Parts Of North India". NDTV.com.-

Data.event_text: 14 February - A 22 year old Indian environmentalist from Bangalore, Disha Ravi, was arrested by the Delhi Police on sedition charges. The police alleged that Ravi edited and circulated a document (toolkit) tweeted by Greta Thunberg relating to the 20202021 Indian farmers' protest.

links.text: -"India: activist arrested over protest 'toolkit' shared by Greta Thunberg". The Guardian. 15 February 2021. Retrieved 26 June 2021.-
-"Explained: Why is Delhi Police probing a farmers' protest 'toolkit' tweeted by Greta Thunberg?". The Indian Express. 22 February 2021. Retrieved 26 June 2021.-
-"What is toolkit case and how it is related to farmers protests". The Times of India. 17 February 2021. Retrieved 26 June 2021.-
-Trivedi, Saurabh (14 February 2021). "Farmers' protests | 22-year-old activist Disha Ravi arrested, sent to Delhi Police custody". The Hindu. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 26 June 2021.-
-Trivedi, Saurabh (14 February 2021). "Farmers' protests | 22-year-old activist Disha Ravi arrested, sent to Delhi Police custody". The Hindu. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 26 June 2021.-

Data.event_text: 23 February - A Delhi court granted bail to Disha Ravi, citing the toolkit she shared as 'innocuous'.

links.text: -Krishnan, Murali (23 February 2021). ""Citizens cannot be put behind bars for disagreeing with State Policies:" Ten reasons why Disha Ravi was granted bail". Bar and Bench. Retrieved 26 June 2021.-
-Singh, Soibam Rocky (23 February 2021). "'Toolkit' case: Delhi court grants bail to Disha Ravi". The Hindu. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 26 June 2021.-

Data.event_text: 24 February - The Motera cricket stadium in Ahmedabad was renamed as Narendra Modi Stadium. It is the world largest cricket stadium with a seating capacity of 132,000.

links.text: -"Largest cricket stadium in Motera, with seating capacity for over 1 lakh fans, renamed as Narendra Modi Stadium". India Today. 24 February 2021. Retrieved 22 July 2021.-
-"Ahmedabad's Sardar Patel stadium renamed to Narendra Modi stadium". Business Standard India. 24 February 2021. Retrieved 22 July 2021.-

Data.event_text: 4 March - Heavily polluted Bellandur Lake in Bangalore catches fire.

links.text: -"Fire breaks out at Bengaluru's Bellandur Lake, officials blame it on a burning garbage pile". The Indian Express. 5 March 2021. Retrieved 19 January 2022.-

Data.event_text: 20 March - Dattatreya Hosabale is elected as the General Secretary of Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh.

links.text: -"Explained: Who is Dattatreya Hosabale, the new RSS sarkaryawah?". The Indian Express. 24 March 2021. Retrieved 22 July 2021.-

Data.event_text: 26 March - 2021 Mumbai hospital fire.

1 April - The Gujarat Assembly amends the Freedom of Religion Act, 2003, bringing in stringent provisions against forcible conversion through marriage or allurement, with the intention of targeting "love jihad". Gujarat became the 3rd state to do so, after Uttar Pradesh and Madhya Pradesh passed similar bills in 2020.

links.text: -Langa, Mahesh (1 April 2021). "Gujarat Assembly passes 'love jihad' law". The Hindu. ISSN 0971-751X. Archived from the original on 6 June 2021. Retrieved 6 June 2021.-
-Langa, Mahesh (1 April 2021). "Gujarat Assembly passes 'love jihad' law". The Hindu. ISSN 0971-751X. Archived from the original on 6 June 2021. Retrieved 6 June 2021.-

Data.event_text: 3 April - 2021 Sukma-Bijapur attack.

8 April - A French online journal Mediapart came out with an investigative journalism piece on the Rafale deal controversy, based on an investigation by the French anti-corruption agency Agence Francaise Anticorruption (AFA). In the report, Mediapart alleged that the jet manufacturer had paid nearly one million Euros to an Indian middleman.

links.text: -"French Plane-Maker Dassault Aviation Denies Fresh Allegations of Corruption in Rafale Deal". The Wire. Retrieved 26 June 2021.-
-Singh, Sushant. "Despite damning new revelations, the Rafale deal is more likely to be investigated in France than in India". The Caravan. Retrieved 26 June 2021.-
-Philippin, Yann (8 April 2021). "'Rafale Papers': the explosive documents in France-India jets deal". Mediapart. Retrieved 26 June 2021.-
-"Indian authorities sat on evidence that millions of euros were paid to Rafale middleman: Mediapart". Scroll.in. 8 April 2021. Retrieved 26 June 2021.-

Data.event_text: 15 April - Adani Ports & SEZ removed from S&P Dow Jones Sustainability Indices due to links and shared financial interests that group have with Tatmadaw that carried out 2021 Myanmar coup d'état.

links.text: -"Adani Ports removed from S&P index due to links with Myanmar military". mint. 13 April 2021. Retrieved 23 July 2021.-
-"S&P Dow Jones to remove Adani Ports from sustainability index for Myanmar 'military links'". @businessline. 13 April 2021. Retrieved 23 July 2021.-

Data.event_text: Virar hospital fire.
A viral video emerged from Madhya Pradesh's Vidisha, showing a dead body falling off a running ambulance draws criticism.

links.text: -"Madhya Pradesh: Body falls out of ambulance in Vidisha district". The Indian Express. 24 April 2021. Retrieved 23 July 2021.-

Data.event_text: 24 April - 25 COVID-19 patients die in Jaipur Golden Hospital, Delhi after the hospital runs out of their oxygen supply.

links.text: -"Oxygen Crisis: 25 Patients Die in Delhi's Jaipur Golden Hospital". The Wire Science. 24 April 2021. Retrieved 20 May 2021.-

Data.event_text: 27 April - The total number of deaths due to COVID-19 in the country cross 2 lakh. However, this is the official figure, with gross amounts of under-reporting suspected.

links.text: -"Coronavirus | COVID-19 death toll crosses 2 lakh; case tally almost 1.8 crore on April 27, 2021". The Hindu. 27 April 2021. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 20 May 2021.-

Data.event_text: 28 April - 2021 Assam earthquake.

29 April - A Supreme Court of India bench presided by Justice Uday U. Lalit refused a Central Bureau of Investigation probe on the controversial death of Chief Minister of Arunachal Pradesh Kalikho Pul.

links.text: -"SC refuses to order CBI probe into death of ex-Arunachal CM Kalikho Pul". The Hindu. 29 April 2021. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 11 July 2021.-
-"SC refuses to order CBI probe into death of ex-Arunachal CM Kalikho Pul". The Hindu. 29 April 2021. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 11 July 2021.-

Data.event_text: 30 April - A Special Bench of Justices Dhananjaya Y. Chandrachud, L. Nageswara Rao and Shripathi Ravindra Bhat warned State governments and police against clamping down on the spread of information or calls for help through social media from citizens affected by the COVID-19 pandemic in India. The bench also questioned lack of equity in vaccine pricing in India.

links.text: -Rajagopal, Krishnadas (30 April 2021). "Coronavirus | Do not clampdown on citizen's SOS calls via social media: Supreme Court". The Hindu. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 27 June 2021.-

-"A timely warning: On Supreme Court intervention against clampdown on information". The Hindu. 1 May 2021. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 27 June 2021.-

Data.event_text: 1 May - Bharuch hospital fire.
2 May - In a joint statement, opposition party leaders asked the Union government to focus all its attention on ensuring uninterrupted oxygen supply to hospitals across the country.

links.text: -"Ensure uninterrupted oxygen supply: Opposition leaders tell Modi government". The Hindu. 2 May 2021. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 26 June 2021.-

Data.event_text: Twitter permanently suspends the account of Kangana Ranaut for hateful posts about the post poll violence in West Bengal.

links.text: -"Twitter permanently suspends Kangana Ranaut's account". The Hindu. 4 May 2021. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 19 July 2021.-

Data.event_text: Delhi High Court issues show cause notice for contempt of court to Government of India on grounds of not meeting court's direction to supply requisite Oxygen for hospitals in Delhi.

links.text: -"'Govt May Be Blind, But Not Court': Delhi HC Tells Centre on Oxygen Shortage". The Wire. Retrieved 23 July 2021.-
-Banka, Richa (5 May 2021). "Delhi High Court pulls up Centre over oxygen crisis". mint. Retrieved 23 July 2021.-

Data.event_text: 5 May - Supreme Court of India strikes down the Maharashtra State Reservation for Socially and Educationally Backward Classes (SEBC) Act, 2018 which extends reservation to the Maratha community in public education and employment and upheld the Indra Sawhney & Others v. Union of India verdict and One Hundred and Second Amendment of the Constitution of India.

links.text: -Roy, Debayan (5 May 2021). "[Breaking] Supreme Court strikes down Maratha Reservation law for exceeding 50 percent cap; upholds Indra Sawhney, 102nd Constitutional Amendment". Bar and Bench - Indian Legal news. Retrieved 13 August 2021.-

Data.event_text: 6 May - Union Minister V. Muraleedharan's convoy attacked at West Bengal.

links.text: -"West Bengal: Union Minister V Muraleedharan's convoy attacked in West Midnapore, claims TMC hand". The Indian Express. 6 May 2021. Retrieved 28 July 2021.-

Data.event_text: 10 May - Nearly 150 decomposed and bloated Human Dead bodies were found floating in River Ganges at Chausa, Buxar district, Bihar. It is believed that these bodies belonged to under-reported death cases of COVID-19 pandemic from neighboring state of Uttar Pradesh.

links.text: -"COVID-19 in Bihar: Horror in Chausa Town As Dead Bodies Wash Up on Banks of Ganga". The Wire. Retrieved 23 July 2021.-
-"Covid-19: India's holiest river is swollen with bodies". BBC News. 19 May 2021. Retrieved 23 July 2021.-

Data.event_text: Thousands of dead bodies are found floating or washing up the shore of the river Ganges. The corpses also include people that died due to Covid-19.

links.text: -"'Uncountable corpses on banks of Ganga': Dainik Bhaskar's front-page story on deaths in UP". Newslaundry. 18 May 2021. Retrieved 20 May 2021.-
-"Bodies of Covid-19 victims among those dumped in Ganga river: Govt". Hindustan Times. 16 May 2021. Retrieved 20 May 2021.-

Data.event_text: In a joint letter to Prime Minister of India, Narendra Modi, twelve opposition parties urged the government to start a free universal mass vaccination program in India. The letter also urged Modi to repeal the farm bills, scrap the Central Vista Redevelopment Project and provide food grains to people.

links.text: -"COVID-19 surge | Opposition parties urge PM Modi to start free, universal vaccination". The Hindu. 12 May 2021. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 26 June 2021.-
-"COVID-19 surge | Opposition parties urge PM Modi to start free, universal vaccination". The Hindu. 12 May 2021. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 26 June 2021.-

Data.event_text: Union Education Minister Ramesh Pokhriyal was admitted to AIIMS, Delhi due to post-Covid complications.

links.text: -"Education Minister Admitted To AIIMS Over Post-Covid Complications". NDTV. 1 May 2021.-

Data.event_text: Amul vice chairman Valamji R Humbal urged Prime Minister Narendra Modi to ban Non-governmental organization People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals in India alleging conspiracy following remarks made by PETA to promote Milk substitute in country.

links.text: -"Ban PETA, Amul vice-chairman urges PM, alleging conspiracy". The Indian Express. 1 June 2021. Retrieved 10 July 2021.-
-"PETA Goes on Attack in India Over Milk Giant's Treatment of Cows". BloombergQuint. 23 June 2021. Retrieved 10 July 2021.-

Data.event_text: 4 June - Delhi High Court dismissed a lawsuit filed by Juhi Chawla against setting up of 5G Cellular network in India and imposed a Rs. 20 Lakh fine for abusing the process of law.

links.text: -"Juhi Chawla's 5G lawsuit dismissed by Delhi HC, ₹20 lakh fine imposed". mint. 4 June 2021. Retrieved 28 July 2021.-

Data.event_text: 7 June -  Pune fire.
Media reports that Government of India may not allow 4 Kerala women who have joined Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant  Khorasan Province to return to India.

links.text: -Singh, Vijaita; Haidar, Suhasini (11 June 2021). "India unlikely to allow return of 4 Kerala women who joined Islamic State". The Hindu. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 26 June 2021.-

Data.event_text: The Economic Offence Wing of Tamil Nadu Police arrests Infrastructure Leasing & Financial Services (IL&FS) former chairman Ravi Parthasarathi in connection with a criminal breach of trust of Rs. 200 crore done by an (IL&FS) subsidiary to a Chennai based firm.

13 June - Aam Aadmi Party Member of Parliament, Rajya Sabha, Sanjay Singh and Pawan Pandey from Samajwadi Party alleged that there were financial irregularities that occurred in the purchase of land for the Ram Mandir, Ayodhya by Shri Ram Janmabhoomi Teerth Kshetra Trust. The politicians alleged that on March 18, 2021, the trust purchased two different plots on same day at two different rates; one transaction appeared manipulated and intended to divert funds.

links.text: -"Temple trust also bought 1.03-hectare plot directly from owners for Rs 8 crore". The Indian Express. 17 June 2021. Retrieved 26 June 2021.-
-"Financial fraud alleged in purchase of land for Ram temple in Ayodhya". The Week. Retrieved 26 June 2021.-

-"AAP and Samajwadi Party allege corruption worth crores by Ram Janmabhoomi Teerth Kshetra Trust members". The New Indian Express. 13 June 2021. Retrieved 26 June 2021.-

Data.event_text: 14 June - Following a tweet by Journalist Sucheta Dalal made on  and decision by National Securities Depository Limited to freeze three Foreign portfolio investment funds based in Port Louis, Mauritius shares of Adani Group companies fell by 5 - 25%.

links.text: -"Journalist Sucheta Dalal trends on Twitter for 'crashing' Adani stocks". Newslaundry. 14 June 2021. Retrieved 26 June 2021.-
-"Why do these foreign funds love Adani Group companies?". The Morning Context. Retrieved 26 June 2021.-

Data.event_text: Student activists from Pinjra Tod Natasha Narwal and Devangana Kalita, along with Asif Iqbal Tanha from Jamia Millia Islamia were released from Tihar Jail on Thursday, hours after a trial court ordered their immediate release. They were in custody since May 2020, in relation to a case related to the violence in 2020 Delhi riots following the Citizenship Amendment Act protests. The trial court order came because the activists who were granted bail by Delhi High Court on  were not released even after 36 hours.

links.text: -"Delhi riots: Trial court ordered immediate release of 3 students, HC informed". The Times of India. 17 June 2021. Retrieved 26 June 2021.-
-"Delhi violence: Devangana Kalita, Natasha Narwal and Asif Iqbal Tanha granted bail by HC". Scroll.in. 15 June 2021. Retrieved 26 June 2021.-
-"Student activists Natasha Narwal, Devangana Kalita, Asif Iqbal Tanha released from Tihar Jail". Scroll.in. 17 June 2021. Retrieved 26 June 2021.-

Data.event_text: Press Trust of India reports on the basis of data compiled from Swiss National Bank that, funds parked by Indian individuals and firms in Swiss banks rose to a 13 year high of 2.55 billion Swiss franc (over Rs 20,700 crore INR) in 2020. Interestingly amidst this spike, customer account deposits witnessed a dip while money deposited through bonds, securities and other financial instruments rose sharply.

links.text: -"Indians' funds in Swiss banks climb to Rs 20,700 crore, highest in 13 years". India Today. 17 June 2021. Retrieved 1 July 2021.-

Data.event_text: A meeting of opposition leaders under the banner of Rashtra Manch (National Forum) met in the residence of Sharad Pawar in Delhi. The group put forward an alternate vision of anti - BJP third front in India for 2021 elections in India. There were leaders from All India Trinamool Congress, Aam Aadmi Party, Rashtriya Lok Dal, Nationalist Congress Party who were present in the event. There were no leaders from Indian National Congress, Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam or Communist Party of India (Marxist). The veteran BJP leader and Trinamool leader Yashwant Sinha who was present in the event said that Manch will remain as a non political action group for the moment. The meeting of leaders took place after meetings between Prashant Kishor and Sharad Pawar earlier this month.

links.text: -"Rashtra Manch meets at Pawar's home, calls for 'alternative vision'". Hindustan Times. 23 June 2021. Retrieved 26 June 2021.-
-"Explained: Why opposition leaders met at Sharad Pawar's home, and where Prashant Kishor fits in". The Indian Express. 24 June 2021. Retrieved 26 June 2021.-

Data.event_text: Kerala High Court issued an interim stay on two controversial orders of Lakshadweep administration on Animal husbandry (closure of dairy farms) and Midday Meal Scheme (exclusion of Non-vegetarian items from menu).

links.text: -Krishnakumar, R. (23 June 2021). "Kerala High Court stays two controversial orders of Lakshadweep administration". Frontline. Retrieved 26 June 2021.-

Data.event_text: 23 June - Enforcement Directorate transferred assets worth ₹8,441.50 crore to public sector banks. The banks suffered losses to the tune of ₹22,585.83 crore due to frauds committed by Vijay Mallya, Nirav Modi and Mehul Choksi.  Thus the total assets transferred to the bank worth Rs 9,041.5 crore, representing 40% of the total loss to the banks. The total attachments and assets seized by Enforcement Directorate amounts to Rs 18,170.02 crore which included assets of Rs 969 crore located in foreign countries. The quantum of the attached and seized assets represents 80.45% of the total bank loss of Rs. 22,585.83 crore.

links.text: -"ED transfers assets of Vijay Mallya, Nirav Modi, Mehul Choksi worth ₹8,441.50 cr. to banks". The Hindu. 23 June 2021. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 26 June 2021.-
-"ED transfers assets of Vijay Mallya, Nirav Modi, Mehul Choksi worth ₹8,441.50 cr. to banks". The Hindu. 23 June 2021. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 26 June 2021.-
-"ED transfers Rs 9,000 crore of Rs 18,000 crore assets seized from Nirav Modi, Mallya and Choksi to banks". India Today. 23 June 2021. Retrieved 26 June 2021.-

Data.event_text: 24 June - Narendra Modi and Amit Shah meets political leaders from Jammu and Kashmir all main leaders from People's Alliance for Gupkar Declaration attended the meeting. PM Modi gives signals regarding elections and restoration of statehood.

links.text: -Dutta, Prabhash K. (25 June 2021). "5 takeaways from PM Narendra Modi's all-party meet on Kashmir". India Today. Retrieved 26 June 2021.-

-"PM Modi meets Jammu and Kashmir leaders". The Hindu. 24 June 2021. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 26 June 2021.-

Data.event_text: M. C. Josephine, Kerala Women's Commission chairperson, resigned following public backlash on her remarks to a woman complaining of domestic violence on  in a live TV show telecasted on Manorama News.

links.text: -"'Then you suffer': Kerala women's panel chief resigns after backlash on comments". The Indian Express. 26 June 2021. Retrieved 26 June 2021.-

Data.event_text: Kerala High Court issued Anticipatory bail to Lakshadweep based film maker, Aisha Sultana, against whom sedition charges were imposed on 10 June following a remark made by her against Union territory administrator Praful Khoda Patel, by calling him 'Bio weapon' in a news debate that happened on a Malayalam news channel, MediaOne TV.

links.text: -Gopakumar, K. c (25 June 2021). "Kerala High Court observes that prima facie sedition case against Aisha Sultana does not stand". The Hindu. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 26 June 2021.-
-Gopakumar, K. c (25 June 2021). "Kerala High Court observes that prima facie sedition case against Aisha Sultana does not stand". The Hindu. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 26 June 2021.-
-"Kerala HC grants anticipatory bail to Lakshadweep filmmaker Aisha Sultana in sedition case". The Indian Express. 25 June 2021. Retrieved 26 June 2021.-
-"Who is Aisha Sultana, the Lakshadweep-based filmmaker facing sedition charges?". The Indian Express. 11 June 2021. Retrieved 26 June 2021.-

Data.event_text: 27 June - European Union excludes anti-COVID-19 vaccine Covishield from 'Green Pass' list.

links.text: -"EU excludes anti-COVID-19 vaccine Covishield from 'Green Pass' list". Money Control. 27 June 2021.-

Data.event_text: 28 June - Qatar's Special Envoy of the State of Qatar for Counterterrorism and Mediation of Conflict Resolution, Mutlaq bin Majed Al Qahtani made a statement in a web conference that Indian officials have entered into talks with Talibans political leadership based in Doha.

links.text: -Haidar, Suhasini (21 June 2021). "Indian delegation met Taliban in Doha, says Qatari official". The Hindu. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 1 July 2021.-
-Haidar, Suhasini (21 June 2021). "Indian delegation met Taliban in Doha, says Qatari official". The Hindu. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 1 July 2021.-

Data.event_text: 1 July - Nine European countries which includes Switzerland, Estonia and 7 European Union member states such as Austria, Germany, Slovenia, Greece, Iceland, Ireland & Spain have given recognition to the Covishield vaccine produced by the Serum Institute of India as EU started 'Green Pass' facility. In the meantime EU member Germany however has a travel ban in place for Indians as India has been recognized as a "virus variant country".

links.text: -"9 European nations recognise Covishield". Hindustan Times. 1 July 2021. Retrieved 2 July 2021.-
-Roche, Elizabeth (1 July 2021). "9 European nations add SII's Covishield to travel pass list". mint. Retrieved 2 July 2021.-

Data.event_text: 4 July - Pushkar Singh Dhami is elected as the 11th Chief Minister of Uttarakhand. He is the youngest chief Minister of the state and is the third chief Minister within the 4th Uttarakhand Assembly.

links.text: -"Pushkar Singh Dhami sworn in as new Uttarakhand CM". The Hindu. 4 July 2021. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 7 July 2021.-
-"Pushkar Singh Dhami sworn in as new Uttarakhand CM". The Hindu. 4 July 2021. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved 7 July 2021.-
-Mahajan, Anilesh S. (5 July 2021). "Why the BJP dropped Tirath Singh Rawat as Uttarakhand chief minister". India Today. Retrieved 7 July 2021.-

Data.event_text: 5 July - Jesuit priest and tribal rights activist, Stan Swamy who was arrested in connection with 2018 Bhima Koregaon violence in October 2020, died in custody at Mumbai. He was the oldest political prisoner in India.

links.text: -"Fury in India over death of 84-year-old political prisoner Stan Swamy". The Guardian. 5 July 2021. Retrieved 7 July 2021.-
-"Stan Swamy: India outrage over death of jailed activist". BBC News. 7 July 2021. Retrieved 7 July 2021.-
-"Explained: Who was Stan Swamy, arrested in the Elgar Parishad case, who passed away on Monday?". The Indian Express. 6 July 2021. Retrieved 7 July 2021.-
-"UN human rights chief, USCIRF chair express concern at Stan Swamy's death". Hindustan Times. 6 July 2021. Retrieved 7 July 2021.-

Data.event_text: 6 July - Government of India creates new ministry named Ministry of Co-operation to strengthen the Cooperative movement in India.

links.text: -Das Gupta, Moushumi (7 July 2021). "Modi govt creates Ministry of Cooperation ahead of cabinet reshuffle". ThePrint. Retrieved 7 July 2021.-

Data.event_text: 7 July - massive reshuffle in the Union Council of Ministers of Second Modi ministry. Twelve existing ministers including Ministry of Health and Family Welfare Harsh Vardhan, Minister of Law and Justice Ravi Shankar Prasad, Prakash Javadekar, D. V. Sadananda Gowda resigns. There are 43 new faces inducted into the ministry including Ashwini Vaishnaw, Jyotiraditya Scindia, Rajeev Chandrasekhar, Sarbananda Sonowal etc. There was elevation in ranks to few existing ministers such as Mansukh L. Mandaviya, Kiren Rijiju, Anurag Thakur etc.

links.text: -Joshi, Poornima (7 July 2021). "In biggest Modi cabinet shuffle, 43 new faces in, 12 old guard out". @businessline. Retrieved 9 July 2021.-
-"Cabinet reshuffle: Full list of ministers in Narendra Modi's government". The Indian Express. 8 July 2021. Retrieved 9 July 2021.-

Data.event_text: 8 July - violence erupts in 12 districts of Uttar Pradesh during filing of the nominations for elections to Panchayat Samiti (Kshethra Panchayats). A video of a woman Samajwadi Party member being assaulted in Lakhimpur Kheri district becomes viral in social media and invited criticism.

links.text: -"Violence erupts in 12 Uttar Pradesh districts during filing of nominations for block pramukh polls". The Times of India. 9 July 2021. Retrieved 19 July 2021.-
-"Explained: In Uttar Pradesh panchayat polls, the high stakes that culminated in violence". The Indian Express. 10 July 2021. Retrieved 19 July 2021.-
-Verma, Abhishek (9 July 2021). "SP leader accuses BJP workers of pulling woman's saree, Akhilesh Yadav attacks CM". India Today. Retrieved 19 July 2021.-

Data.event_text: 9 July - External Affairs Minister, S. Jaishankar handed over a relic belonging to Ketevan the Martyr, a royal from the 17th-century, that was preserved in Church of St. Augustine, Goa to the Government of Georgia as part of his two-day visit to the country.

links.text: -Perur, Srinath (9 April 2016). "Hunting for a Georgian queen in Goa". mint. Retrieved 13 July 2021.-
-Basu, Nayanima (10 July 2021). "Georgia moved as Jaishankar brings home a 17th-century queen killed for refusing conversion". ThePrint. Retrieved 13 July 2021.-

Data.event_text: 11 July - An unconfirmed report in a Tamil daily about the Union government's plan to divide Tamil Nadu and create Kongu Nadu as a Union territory sparked row in Tamil Nadu. The report draw cue from a list of newly appointed ministers published by BJP, where L. Murugan, was mentioned as hailing from Kongu Nadu. All major political party except Bharatiya Janata Party denounced the idea of splitting Tamil Nadu.

links.text: -"Kongu Nadu as Union Territory? Unconfirmed reports stir controversy in Tamil Nadu; BJP slammed". www.timesnownews.com. 12 July 2021. Retrieved 19 July 2021.-
-"Explained: How Kongu Nadu Grabbed Headlines And Why TN Leaders Have Hit Out At BJP For Raking Up Issue". News18. 14 July 2021. Retrieved 19 July 2021.-
-"Major Tamil Nadu parties reject 'Kongu Nadu' idea, but BJP remains noncommittal". The New Indian Express. 12 July 2021. Retrieved 19 July 2021.-

Data.event_text: 14 July - The Supreme Court of India takes suo moto case on Uttar Pradesh's decision to go ahead with Kanwar Yatra despite apprehensions about a third wave of COVID-19 pandemic in India.

links.text: -"Uttar Pradesh call to allow Kanwar Yatra disturbing, respond by tomorrow, says Supreme Court". The Indian Express. 15 July 2021. Retrieved 15 July 2021.-

Data.event_text: 15 July - as part of hearings on Public interest litigation challenging the constitutional validity of Section 124A of the Indian Penal Code, Supreme Court of India expressed concern over its widespread misuse and lack of accountability of invoking sedition law. The court sought center's response regarding necessity to retain this colonial law.

links.text: -Kumar, Pramod (15 July 2021). "SC terms sedition law British colonial legacy, asks Centre why retain it". Deccan Chronicle. Retrieved 19 July 2021.-
-"SC to Examine Validity of Sedition Law After PIL Calls it Unconstitutional, Seeks Centre's Response". News18. 1 May 2021. Retrieved 19 July 2021.-

Data.event_text: 2021 Mumbai landslide

A leaked database of an Israeli surveillance technology firm NSO Group that sells a spyware called Pegasus (spyware) was accessed by a Paris-based media nonprofit Forbidden Stories and Amnesty International. The database contained data of government clients of Pegasus (spyware) since 2016. The non profit group worked on this data through an international collaborative journalism of 17 media groups from 10 countries including The Wire (India), Le Monde, The Guardian, The Washington Post, Süddeutsche Zeitung etc.  The Indian media partner in the group, The Wire reveals that the data contains more than 300 Indians who were under surveillance through Pegasus. This includes 40 journalists,  opposition politicians, a supreme court judge, activists, two ministers of Modi ministry, an Election Commissioner etc. The prominent people who figured in Pegasus surveillance according to the data were Rahul Gandhi,  Prashant Kishor, Ashok Lavasa, Ranjan Gogoi, Ashwini Vaishnaw etc. The Prime Minister's Office denied the allegations citing they are baseless and lack concrete evidence.

links.text: -"Pegasus Project: How Phones of Journalists, Ministers, Activists May Have Been Used to Spy On Them". thewire.in. Retrieved 21 July 2021.-
-"Pegasus Project Day 2: Rahul Gandhi, Prashant Kishor, Ashok Lavasa, Ashwini Vaishnaw, Prahlad Patel". The Wire. Retrieved 21 July 2021.-

Data.event_text: 19 July - Raj Kundra, the spouse of Shilpa Shetty arrested by Mumbai Police on charges of making pornographic content and publishing it through mobile application named Hotshot.

links.text: -"Why was Raj Kundra arrested? Here's a timeline of the controversial adult content creation case". The Times of India. Retrieved 21 July 2021.-

Data.event_text: 20 July - In an answer to the Rajya Sabha, to an unstarred question raised by K. C. Venugopal, Bharati Pawar, Minister of State of Ministry of Health and Family Welfare said, that there were no deaths due to lack of oxygen in India during the second wave.

links.text: -"Covid-19: India outrage over 'no oxygen shortage death data' claim". BBC News. 21 July 2021. Retrieved 23 July 2021.-

Data.event_text: Income Tax Department conducted raids on Dainik Bhaskar media group.

links.text: -"Tax department raids multiple premises of media group Dainik Bhaskar". National Herald. 22 July 2021. Retrieved 22 July 2021.-

Data.event_text: 2021 Maharashtra floods begin
23 July - Indian Food delivery company Zomato Initial public offering list in stock market at a premium of 53% over issue price.

links.text: -"Zomato IPO listing: Stocks open at 53% premium over issue price". Firstpost. 23 July 2021. Retrieved 7 August 2021.-

Data.event_text: 24 July - Indian weightlifter Saikhom Mirabai Chanu won Olympic silver medal in 2020 Summer Olympics held at Tokyo.

links.text: -"Olympics: Mirabai Chanu wins silver medal in Weightlifting Women's 49Kg category". mint. 24 July 2021. Retrieved 7 August 2021.-

Data.event_text: 25 July - Ramappa Temple in Telangana gets UNESCO World Heritage Site tag.

links.text: -"Telangana's Ramappa temple gets Unesco's world heritage tag; congratulations to all, tweets PM Modi". The Times of India. 25 July 2021. Retrieved 26 July 2021.-

Data.event_text: B. S. Yediyurappa resigns as chief minister of Karnataka.

links.text: -Menon, Aditya (27 July 2021). "BS Yediyurappa Resigns as Karnataka CM: His Successor Will Be Up Against History". TheQuint. Retrieved 27 July 2021.-

Data.event_text: Almost five Assam Police personnel at Cachar district killed as a result of violent clashes between Mizoram Police and Assam Police along the state border following a border dispute.

links.text: -"Five Assam policemen killed in violent turn to border dispute with Mizoram". The Indian Express. 27 July 2021. Retrieved 27 July 2021.-
-"Explained: The Assam-Mizoram border dispute, and its roots in two notifications dating to 1875 and 1933". The Indian Express. 27 July 2021. Retrieved 27 July 2021.-

Data.event_text: 28 July - Basavaraj Bommai, Lingayat leader and son of former chief minister S. R. Bommai takes oath as  chief minister of Karnataka.

links.text: -"Karnataka Bengaluru Live Updates: Basavaraj Bommai to take oath as CM today". The Indian Express. 28 July 2021. Retrieved 28 July 2021.-
